text:
Just posted this: <https://discourse.julialang.org/t/how-to-install-the-latest-package-given-dependency-conflicts/56623> Would be great if someone has a solution.

<@UBVE598BC> I tried `dev`ing the package, but it still downgrades some of dependencies.

attachments.title: How to install the latest package given dependency conflicts
attachments.text: In a fresh environment I am trying to install DifferentialEquations and Gnuplot 1.30. If I install DifferentialEquations first, I get the latest copy of the package + all the correct dependencies (particular the dependency [1dea7af3] + OrdinaryDiffEq v5.51.2 which includes some critical bug fixes for me). Then I add Gnuplot by add Gnuplot, but I am guessing due to dependencies it only installs Gnuplot 1.0. The latest version is 1.3. I can force 1.30 by add Gnuplot@1.30 but this severely downgr...
attachments.fallback: JuliaLang: How to install the latest package given dependency conflicts

elements.text: Would be great if someone has a solution.
ing the package, but it still downgrades some of dependencies.

text: Just developing packages makes no difference to compatibilities. To make a difference you need to find the critical package, develop it, and change the `[compat]` section in its `Project.toml` appropriately.

elements.text: Just developing packages makes no difference to compatibilities. To make a difference you need to find the critical package, develop it, and change the

text: I think its more of a bug in Pkg?

elements.text: I think its more of a bug in Pkg?

text: No, it's working as intented. Latest Gnuplot depends on DataStructures 0.17. Latest OrdinaryDiffEq depends on DataStructures 0.18.

elements.text: No, it's working as intented. Latest Gnuplot depends on DataStructures 0.17. Latest OrdinaryDiffEq depends on DataStructures 0.18.

text: But from Compat of Gnuplot, it depends on `DataStructures = "^0.17"` ... dosn't that mean anything 0.17 and above?

elements.text: But from Compat of Gnuplot, it depends on
... dosn't that mean anything 0.17 and above?

text: Best solution is to update Gnuplot to be compatible with DataStructures 0.18. Depending on what changed in DataStructures and how Gnuplot uses it this may require updating the Gnuplot code or possibly just verifying that it still works fine with the newer DataStructures and bump the Compat.

elements.text: Best solution is to update Gnuplot to be compatible with DataStructures 0.18. Depending on what changed in DataStructures and how Gnuplot uses it this may require updating the Gnuplot code or possibly just verifying that it still works fine with the newer DataStructures and bump the Compat.

text: No, `^0.17` covers all `0.17.x` but not 0.18. Below major version 1 a bump in minor version counts as breaking.

elements.text: but not 0.18. Below major version 1 a bump in minor version counts as breaking.

text: Thanks, that solves the issue. I will dev the package and update manually. I don't know why but `Pkg` is one of the most tricky things to get my head around

elements.text: Thanks, that solves the issue. I will dev the package and update manually. I don't know why but
is one of the most tricky things to get my head around

text: It takes compatibility seriously. Sometimes it's a headache but most of the time it's a blessing.

elements.text: It takes compatibility seriously. Sometimes it's a headache but most of the time it's a blessing.

text:
Okay so now I have a dev'ed package, but
```(julpack) pkg> add Gnuplot
   Updating registry at `~/.julia/registries/General`
   Updating git-repo `<https://github.com/JuliaRegistries/General.git>`
  Resolving package versions...
Updating `~/julpack/Project.toml`
  [dc211083] + Gnuplot v1.0.0
Updating `~/julpack/Manifest.toml`
  [3da002f7] + ColorTypes v0.10.10
  [53c48c17] + FixedPointNumbers v0.8.4
  [dc211083] + Gnuplot v1.0.0
  [a39b5e78] + ReusePatterns v0.2.0
  [d2514e9c] + StructC14N v0.3.0```
Still adds old `Gnuplot`. Is there a way to tell Pkg to add a dev'ed package rather than from registry?

. Is there a way to tell Pkg to add a dev'ed package rather than from registry?
